perturbation.original_text: 1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  the  Content  ("Content" as set forth in APPENDIX 2)           owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users  in  the  territory  ("Territory" as set forth in           APPENDIX  2).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  The purpose  of  this  content  distribution  Agreement  (hereinafter           "Agreement")  is  to  set  forth  the terms and conditions under which           plan_b  may  use  certain material owned  or  licensed  by  LICENSOR  for  a  commercial  distribution to           plan_b's  End  Users in an unspecified territory.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Content' and 'Territory' with explicit reference to APPENDIX 2. The modified text removes this appendix reference, making the definition of these key terms ambiguous. This omission directly contradicts later sections that rely on these terms, creating uncertainty in enforcement. The replacement of 'Content' with 'certain material' introduces further ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
4    REVENUES

     4.1  plan_b  shall  pay  LICENSOR  a  share of its revenues as set forth in           APPENDIX  2  ("REVENUES").

     4.2  All shares  are  net,  plus  the  respective  applying value added tax           (if  applicable).
perturbation.changed_text:
4    REVENUES

     4.1  plan_b  shall  pay  LICENSOR  a  share of its revenues. The specific details of revenue sharing are subject to separate negotiation.

     4.2  All shares  are  net,  plus  the  respective  applying value added tax           (if  applicable).
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly refers to APPENDIX 2 for revenue share details. The modified text removes this reference and introduces the idea of 'separate negotiation,' creating uncertainty regarding the agreed-upon revenue share. Even though, it is said that 'All shares are net', there are no values for this shares, therefore, revenue cannot be calculated properly.

perturbation.original_text:
7    TERM OF  THE  AGREEMENT  AND  TERMINATION

     7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter           Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the           effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the           terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be           extended  for  an additional period of half a year unless either party           provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of           the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.

     7.2  Either  Party  shall  be  entitled  to  cancel  this  Agreement if the           other Party is materially in breach of the terms of this Agreement. If           the  breach  of  contract is capable of being remedied, this Agreement           can  be  cancelled  only  provided  that  the  Party in breach has not           rectified  its breach within thirty (30) days of the written notice by           the  other  Party.
perturbation.changed_text:
7    TERM OF  THE  AGREEMENT  AND  TERMINATION

     7.1  The term of this letter Agreement shall continue for an indefinite period unless terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be           extended for an additional period unless either party provides the           other party with written notification of termination of the letter Agreement.

     7.2  Either  Party  shall  be  entitled  to  cancel  this  Agreement if the           other Party is materially in breach of the terms of this Agreement. If           the  breach  of  contract is capable of being remedied, this Agreement           can  be  cancelled  only  provided  that  the  Party in breach has not           rectified  its breach within a reasonable time of the written notice by the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specified a 24-month term and a 60-day notice period, with a reference to Appendix 2. The modified text removes both the reference and the explicit timeframes, making the term 'indefinite' and replacing '30 days' with 'reasonable time'. This alteration introduces significant uncertainty and contradicts the original intent, potentially leading to disputes regarding the duration and termination of the agreement.
